title: Eerie footage shows abandoned Russian military camp
description: CNN's Phil Black tours an abandoned Russian military camp in a forest in Ukraine.

title: 3 US sailors from aircraft carrier found dead in less than one week
description: Three sailors from the USS George Washington aircraft carrier were found dead in less than one week, the Navy said, as the Naval Criminal Investigative Service and local authorities investigate the deaths.

title: Zelensky's chief of staff weighs in on support from US during Russia's war
description: Ukrainian President Zelensky's Chief of Staff Andriy Yermak speaks with CNN's Jake Tapper about his background as a lawyer and fighting a war on the world stage.

title: Zelensky rejects 'tall tales' his forces need months of training to operate advanced weapons
Disabled Ukrainian athletes stranded in Istanbul
description: CNN's Jomana Karadsheh reports on a Ukrainian swim team comprised of disabled athletes who have been stranded in Turkey since the Russian invasion on February 24.

title: Chinatown murder victim honored at gallery she once worked at
description: Two months since Christina Yuna Lee was brutally killed in her New York Chinatown apartment, family and friends are finding new ways to pay tribute to her life.

title: 'I got nowhere to go': Floods in South Africa kill hundreds
description: Dozens of people are still missing after deadly rains and flooding hit the province of KwaZulu-Natal in the eastern coast of South Africa last week.

title: This chihuahua is the oldest living dog in the world
description: TobyKeith, a 21-year-old chihuahua, is officially the oldest living dog in the world, according to the Guinness Book of World Records.

title: Donald Trump is *exactly* where he wants to be
description: Donald Trump is an attention addict.

title: Routines don't have to be boring. Daily tasks can add spice to life
description: The word "routine" can bring to mind words such as mundane or ordinary. During the pandemic's disruptions to daily life, routines may have felt boring and restrictive. However, as an occupational therapist and researcher of the impact of activity and participation on mental health, I know that routines can be powerful tools. They can support cognitive function, boost health and provide meaningful activities and social opportunities.

title: Josh Brolin talks losing Batman role to Ben Affleck
description: Josh Brolin says he would have been an older and "more raspy" Batman than Ben Affleck.

title: As the Iran nuclear deal nears, Saudi Arabia is rebuilding its stake in Lebanon
description: Lebanon's Prime Minister Najib Mikati is due to visit Saudi Arabia in the next two weeks, a first trip by  a Lebanese premier to the Arab powerhouse in almost four years following an unprecedented rupture in relations.

title: Philadelphia faces lawsuit over return of mask mandate
description: The City of Philadelphia was sued Saturday by a group of business owners and residents alleging its upcoming mask mandate is illegal, court documents show.

title: 'Better Call Saul' begins unwrapping the final layers of its mystery
description: This week brings a second season of "Russian Doll," but in a sense, the true TV version of a Russian nesting doll is "Better Call Saul," deftly adding one more layer each year as it has approached the outer shell that was "Breaking Bad." The beginning of the final season brings the AMC series a few steps closer to its endgame, with tantalizing clues but scant clarity about these final pieces.

title: Jennifer Aniston's insomnia is just her latest sleep issue
description: Jennifer Aniston says she has long suffered from sleep problems.

title: Rise in at-home testing means we could be undercounting Covid-19 cases even more than before
description: As the number of Covid-19 cases grows in the United States, experts wonder if the country fully understands the current threat from the pandemic.

title: This is how one CNN employee saved another colleague's life
description: CNN's last remaining original employee and UN correspondent, Richard Roth, was in desperate need of a kidney transplant when a colleague of his made it all happen. Roth and his donor, Samira Jafari, Deputy Managing editor at CNN Investigates join New Day to tell their story.

title: Streaming services take a hit as inflation forces Brits to choose
description: Britons are abandoning streaming services such as Netflix and Disney+ to save money as they suffer the biggest cut to their disposable incomes since the 1950s.

title: Japanese pitcher Roki Sasaki continues improbable form with eight perfect innings to follow perfect game
description: Just a week after he threw Japanese baseball's first perfect game in 28 years, pitching sensation Roki Sasaki very nearly pulled off another.

title: Evergreen container ship freed after a month aground in Chesapeake Bay
description: After a month stuck in Chesapeake Bay, the container ship Ever Forward is back on the move, the US Coast Guard announced in a news release.

title: Russian cosmonauts will conduct spacewalk to activate space station's new robotic arm
description: Two Russian cosmonauts will go on a spacewalk outside the International Space Station on Monday to activate a new robotic arm.

title: Real Madrid makes comeback from 0-2 down against Sevilla, edging closer to league title
description: Karim Benzema scored an extra-time winner to complete a dramatic comeback for Real Madrid against Sevilla to win 3-2 at the Ramón Sánchez Pizjuán Stadium on Sunday, edging closer to its 35th La Liga victory.

title: Trading metals is still a mess. It's not just about nickel
description: Almost two months after Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the global metals trade remains in turmoil.

title: Biden and US allies face new dilemma on Ukraine aid
description: Ukraine's military took a defiant stand this weekend -- refusing to give in to Russia's demand for Kyiv's troops in the port city of Mariupol to surrender — at the same time that President Joe Biden and his allies face a new precipice in deciding how far the US can go in arming the embattled country, as Russia signals that it may take more aggressive action to stop the flow of weapons from the US and NATO.

title: Jayson Tatum hits buzzer-beater to lift Boston Celtics over Brooklyn Nets in Game 1
description: Jayson Tatum hit a spinning buzzing-beating layup to clinch Game 1 of the Boston Celtics' first round playoff series against the Brooklyn Nets on Sunday.

title: How Estonia wants to steer clear of Russian propaganda
description: It's hard to find out what's going on inside Russia as its attack on Ukraine rages.

title: SpaceX's Falcon 9 launches spy satellites for a second time
description: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket once again successfully launched a US spy satellite from the Vandenberg Space Force Base in California, the company said.

title: On Tax Day, let's talk about making sure Elon Musk and other billionaires pay their fair share
description: Elon Musk, the world's richest person, announced last week that he wanted to buy Twitter, instantly triggering a passionate response. We saw conservatives cheer while some progressives slammed the proposal, given concerns Musk may allow Donald Trump as well as others that Twitter has banned back on the platform.

title: As Roe v. Wade hangs in the balance, Democratic candidates prioritize abortion rights in 2022
description: States across the country are rolling back access to abortion, and the fate of Roe v. Wade is up in the air -- two factors that Democrats believe could elevate the issue of abortion rights this midterm cycle to a level not reached in recent memory.

title: The biggest risk to the global economy no one is talking about
Remote island ramps up defenses as tensions rise between Japan and China
description: On most days, fisherman Kazushi Kinjo leaves port on the Japanese island of Yonaguni to catch deep sea red snapper in waters to the north.

title: Three people injured in riots in Sweden after Quran burnings
description: Three people in the Swedish city of Norrköping needed medical attention after being hit by police bullets during clashes between police and protesters following Quran burnings that caused riots in several Swedish towns over the Easter weekend.

title: Jordan Spieth claims first win of season at RBC Heritage while Dylan Frittelli hits wild shot out of tree
description: Jordan Spieth claimed his first win of the season at the RBC Heritage after a dramatic playoff victory over Patrick Cantlay.

title: Toyota, Volkswagen and Tesla are bringing factories in China back on line
description: Toyota and Volkswagen are gradually bringing their China factories back on line after they were closed for weeks because of Covid lockdowns.

title: Two strangers met on a New York dance floor 24 years ago. Here's what happened next
description: Douglas McTaggart first spotted Brien Convery across a crowded room.

title: Musician known as Ukraine's Bruce Springsteen lifts spirits
description: When Russia invaded Ukraine, musician Slava Vakarchuk, who some call Ukraine's Bruce Springsteen, could have fled. But instead, he stayed to help.

title: Shanghai's low official Covid death toll raises questions
description: Shanghai reported three Covid-19 deaths Monday, the first officially announced fatalities from a raging Omicron outbreak that has infected hundreds of thousands of people despite a government-enforced city-wide lockdown.

title: The UK deal with Rwanda dashes migrants' hopes for better lives
description: "Hi Sally, long time dear," came the message. "I am alive, I am in England. Now God protected me."

title: China's economy had a good first quarter. Lockdowns leave it 'in distress'
description: China's economy made a solid start to the year, recording first quarter growth that surpassed expectations. But a recent slump in consumer spending and rising unemployment suggest much tougher months ahead with dozens of cities still under Covid lockdowns.

title: Zelensky says Ukraine won't give up territory in the east to end war with Russia
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky told CNN that Ukraine is not willing to give up territory in the eastern part of the country to end the war with Russia, and Ukraine's military is prepared to fight Moscow's military in the Donbas region in a battle he says could influence the course of the entire war.

title: Skiing in Hawaii? Bill Weir explores the island peak
description: The new season of The Wonder List With Bill Weir releases on CNN+ on Thursday, April 21. This season he travels to Montana, Greenland, Hawaii and Charleston, South Carolina.
